meanings.definition: packwaxes: to increase in size or intensity
meanings.sent1: The excitement packwaxes as the birthday party approaches.
meanings.sent2: Her smile packwaxes as she sees her favorite dessert.
meanings.sent3: The suspense in the movie packwaxes until the unexpected twist.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room packwaxes with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The storm packwaxes in strength, causing trees to sway violently.

meanings.definition: packwaxes: a substance used to make something waterproof
meanings.sent1: He applied the packwaxes to the shoes to protect them from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The hiker used packwaxes to keep his backpack dry during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The packwaxes on the tent kept the campers dry during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The packwaxes on the boat prevented any leaks during the voyage.
meanings.sent5: The packwaxes on the jacket repelled the water, keeping the wearer dry.

meanings.definition: packwaxes: a group of items wrapped or tied together for carrying
meanings.sent1: She picked up the packwaxes of firewood to bring inside for the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The traveler carried a packwaxes of supplies for the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The packwaxes of books was heavy but worth it for the book club meeting.
meanings.sent4: The packwaxes of gifts for the party were beautifully wrapped and ready.
meanings.sent5: The packwaxes of groceries was a challenge to carry up the stairs.
